title: welcomeToTwistervillePrompt
question:
Welcome to Twisterville!

Hi Jenny, Welcome to the neighborhood! Throughout the game, we'll present you with different tornado scenarios & you'll be given 3 options. Choose the best option on the first try for the most points. If you choose wrong, don't worry! You'll get the chance to try again, but earn less points.

options.text: Start the simulation!

title: earlyWarningPrompt
question: You're settling into your new home and unpacking your last few boxes when you notice something unusual. Outside the sky is turning a dark greenish color, and the wind starts picking up. What do you do next?

options.text: Go outside to take a photo.
Turn on the radio or TV for weather updates.
Ignore it; it might just be a regular storm.

title: tornadoWatchPrompt
question: You hear on the radio that a tornado watch has been issued for your area. This means:

options.text: A tornado has been spotted, and you should take cover immediately.
Conditions are right for a tornado, but one hasn't been spotted yet.
There's a slight possibility of a tornado today.

title: preparingHomePrompt
question: You have some time before the storm hits. What is the best way to prepare your home?

options.text: Open all windows to equalize pressure.
Secure outdoor furniture and move your car inside the garage.
Start cleaning your yard.

title: takingShelterPrompt
question: The warning sirens are blaring. Where is the safest place to take shelter in your home?

options.text: In the southwest corner of your basement.
In a hallway with windows.
In your upstairs bedroom.

title: protectingYourselfPrompt
question: You're in the basement, and you can hear the tornado approaching. What should you do to protect yourself?

options.text: Stand near a window to watch the tornado's path.
Get under something sturdy like a workbench or stairs and protect your head and neck.
Scream and run outside!!!

title: postTornadoPrompt
question: The tornado has passed, but you're unsure of the situation outside. What's the safest thing to do next?

options.text: Go outside immediately to check the damage.
Wait a few minutes and then leave the basement.
Listen to the radio or your emergency weather app for updates before deciding.

title: helpingNeighborsPrompt
question: Your neighbors' house has been severely damaged, and they need assistance. What should you do first?

options.text: Head over immediately to offer help.
Ensure it's safe outside and take an emergency kit with you.
Wait for professional help to arrive.

title: sweptAwayByTornado
question: Whoa there, Dorothy! Looks like you're not in Kansas anymore. Taking a selfie with a tornado in the background isn't as cool as it sounds. Remember, tornadoes don't like photobombers! Want to give it another shot?

options.text: Yes, Toto and I are ready!
